intro: Paepalanthus strictus, commonly known as the rigid puya, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, tall spikes of white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Paepalanthus strictus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
